userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: When you get a cold/flu/bronchitis/allergies, talk to your doctor to find out if temporary changes to your medications should be made.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: More apples, tea, plain yogurt; less flavorings, especially in sticky things like sugary drinks, mouthwash, and candy.  Fresh air (away from triggers) when you're having symptoms is crucial, but fresh air when you're healthy is also very important.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Make and keep your home and car trigger-free zones; hey your family and visitors on board.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Find a doctor who listens.  Track your asthma (time, place, symptom, severity, trigger, treatment, effect) in an app or small note book.  Take your Rx as prescribed, but if you're concerned or confused talk to your doctor until you get answers.  Don't delay treatments, and get fresh air away from triggers.  Steam shower immediately after nebulizer treatments may make them more effective.  Eat clean, avoid artificial flavors, sweeteners, and preservatives.  Hot tea, lemon (juice or zest), ginger, yogurt, apples, and olive oil are all foods that may help immediately (tea, lemon, ginger) or long term.

condition.description:
Asthma is a chronic disease that affects your airways. Your airways are tubes that carry air in and out of your lungs. If you have asthma, the inside walls of your airways become sore and swollen. That makes them very sensitive, and they may react strongly to things that you are allergic to or find irritating. When your airways react, they get narrower and your lungs get less air.

Symptoms of asthma include

  • Wheezing
  • Coughing, especially early in the morning or at night
  • Chest tightness
  • Shortness of breath

Not all people who have asthma have these symptoms. Having these symptoms doesn't always mean that you have asthma. Your doctor will diagnose asthma based on lung function tests, your medical history, and a physical exam. You may also have allergy tests.

When your asthma symptoms become worse than usual, it's called an asthma attack. Severe asthma attacks may require emergency care, and they can be fatal.

Asthma is treated with two kinds of medicines: quick-relief medicines to stop asthma symptoms and long-term control medicines to prevent symptoms.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute

basics.benefits_moa: Advair is a combination medicine. Fluticasone (a corticosteroid) lowers lung inflammation to control asthma and COPD. Salmeterol (a bronchodilator) relaxes muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Advair is good for people who need two medicines to control their asthma or COPD, but it might be expensive since there's no generic available.
downsides: You have to use Advair every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
The HFA inhaler isn't approved to treat COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma-related death
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Advair. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Advair should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

risks_warnings.title: Pneumonia
risks_warnings.description: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
COPD includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema

description_processed.orig: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Advair too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Advair.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping Advair too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Advair may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.
risk_factors: Higher dose of the corticosteroid medication contained in Advair

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Advair may occur. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Advair, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: Advair may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Advair, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: History of arrhythmia, hypertension or heart failure

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction

basics.benefits_moa: Mometasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Mometasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Some people who take this medicine are able to stop other asthma medications or use their fast-acting (rescue) inhalers less often.

risks_warnings.title: Bone loss
risks_warnings.description: Dulera contains mometasone, a corticosteroid. In studies, people taking mometasone for a long time had reduced bone density (bone thickness) in the spine compared to placebo (sugar pill). It’s not clear if this caused more fractures. If you have any risk factors like not moving around, smoking, family history of postmenopausal bone loss, or are on medicines that can thin your bones, let your doctor know before taking Dulera.

It can take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Dulera if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Dulera can reduce growth rate in children. Your doctor should use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and monitor height while taking Dulera.

carousel_items: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

basics.benefits_moa: Medrol is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Medrol is corticosteroid available in many forms (oral, injectable) that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Medrol dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Medrol with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

carousel_items: Use Triamcinolone once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

basics.benefits_moa: Triamcinolone is a nasal steroid. It works directly in your nose to help reduce swelling and inflammation from allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Triamcinolone is the only medication in its class available over the counter for treating stuffy and runny nose due to allergies. You have to use it every day for it to work.
downsides: Can't be used on as-needed basis. Must be taken every day.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left.
Since the medicine in Triamcinolone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.
Needs to be primed before use and re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on as-needed basis. Must be taken every day.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left.
Since the medicine in Triamcinolone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.
Needs to be primed before use and re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.

upsides: Available over the counter without a prescription.
First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in the nasal septum
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Triamcinolone can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Triamcinolone before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. If you are taking Triamcinolone over the counter, talk to your doctor if you've hurt your nose or you've had surgery in your nose.

carousel_items: Be sure to take Prednisolone in the morning to help imitate your bodies release of cortisol. This will also help you sleep better at night.
You can crush the tablets and take Prednisolone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Prednisolone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Stay away from people who are sick because Prednisolone can make lower your bodies ability to fight infection.
Many people gain weight while taking Prednisolone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.
Avoid direct sunlight while taking this medication. When you can’t avoid it, be sure to use sunscreen. It’s also important to put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisolone is an intermediate-acting synthetic corticosteroid. Researchers are not sure exactly sure how it decreases inflammation, but it seems to block the proteins that trigger inflammation. It also seems to affect the hormones used in balance our water and break carbohydrates down.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisolone and similar anti-inflammatory medications work great, but you have to be willing to deal with a list of side effects.
downsides: You will probably have to take additional medications in order to treat your condition.

Prednisolone and similar corticosteroids come with lots of side effects including an including an increased appetite, irritability, swelling of the ankles and feet, increased blood sugar, and decreased healing.
Taking Prednisolone as a long-term medication may lead to permanent side effects.
You must have blood tests often while taking Prednisolone to make sure your body is processing it correctly.
You can’t be around others who are sick, conceive a child, or get vaccinations while taking Prednisolone.

You can’t be around others who are sick, conceive a child, or get vaccinations while taking Prednisolone.

upsides: While Prednisolone is used for several conditions, and in combination with other medications, in one study Prednisolone was 96.6% successful in reducing the symptoms of an autoimmune condition.
You probably won’t have to take Prednisolone very long because it decreases inflammation, and reduces pain rather quickly.
Depending on how long you take Prednisolone, most of its side effects go away after you stop taking it.
Prednisolone comes in several forms, including a dissolvable tablet.
taking Prednisolone or other glucocorticoids gives the body energy to help fight the stress caused by bleeding, trauma, infection, or disease.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Be sure to take Prednisolone in the morning to help imitate your bodies release of cortisol. This will also help you sleep better at night.
You can crush the tablets and take Prednisolone with your food or drink. Do not open up a capsule, they need to be swallowed whole.
Be sure not to stop taking Prednisolone suddenly, as it can lead to loss of appetite, nausea, weakness, low blood pressure, and low blood sugar.
Stay away from people who are sick because Prednisolone can make lower your bodies ability to fight infection.
Many people gain weight while taking Prednisolone. Using a weight loss program, eating smaller portions, and drinking a glass of water before meals tend to help.
Avoid direct sunlight while taking this medication. When you can’t avoid it, be sure to use sunscreen. It’s also important to put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

risks_warnings.title: Eye Problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisolone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye. Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Heart and Kidney Problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking large doses of Prednisolone can cause high blood pressure, water retention and an imbalance of your electrolytes. Your doctor may advise you restrict salt intake, and take calcium supplements.

risks_warnings.title: adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisolone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisolone need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop your medication.

risks_warnings.title: increased risk for infection
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisolone for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisolone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisolone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers

carousel_items: To load the Pulmicort inhaler for a dose, twist the brown grip as far as it will go both ways. When it’s ready, you will hear it click.
Be sure to rinse your mouth out after using Pulmicort. This will help decrease the chances of throat irritation, mouth infection, and loosing your voice.
Your Pulmicort inhaler comes with 60 or 120 doses. To make sure you have enough, check the dose indicator right under the mouthpiece.
You don’t need to use a spacer with the Pulmicort inhaler. If you use other inhalers, ask your doctor what order to take them in.
Avoid asthma triggers like dust mites, pets, indoor mold, pollen, any type of smoke, and vacuum cleaning to protect your airways from being irritated.
Always have your rescue inhaler with you just in case you do have an asthma attack. Pulmicort will reduce your chances of having an asthma attack, but it won't completely get rid of them.

basics.benefits_moa: Pulmicort is an inhaled corticosteroid. It reduces inflammation in the inside lining in your airways by blocking the proteins that trigger inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Pulmicort works well for long-term asthma control, but isn't a rescue inhaler (so it won't stop a sudden asthma attack).
downsides: Usually starts working in 1 to 2 days, but it can take up to 6 weeks before the full effects of Pulmicort are felt.
The medication won’t work if it's not inhaled correctly, so make sure you're using the inhaler properly. A pharmacist can give you some help if you need it.
Some people get a stuffy nose, sore throat, or a cough when using Pulmicort.

upsides: In clinical studies, inhaled Pulmicort has been shown to increase FEV1 (the amount of air a person can forcibly blow out in 1 second) in people who have asthma.
Can be used with quick-acting asthma inhalers that'll open up your airways quickly in case of an attack.
The Pulmicort inhaler can be used in people 6 years and older.
Inhaled medications like Pulmicort work faster than pills, since it goes directly into your lungs.
Available as a generic inhaler.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth infections
risks_warnings.description: Using Pulmicort can cause a fungal infection in the mouth known as candida albicans. It can be treated with oral or topical medications. To decrease your chances of this infection, be sure to rinse your mouth with water each time you use Pulmicort.

risks_warnings.title: Acute asthma
risks_warnings.description: Pulmicort is not used for rapid relief of acute asthma. If your symptoms don’t go away after using your regular short acting rescue inhaler, contact your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pulmicort can cause a serious allergic reactions like skin rash, fever, swelling and trouble breathing. While this is rare, it is a life-threatening emergency. Get medical help right away. Pulmicort contains a small amount of lactose. For this reason, people with severe milk allergy should be careful if they have severe cough, wheezing, or tightness in their chest.

risks_warnings.title: Switching from oral corticosteroid
risks_warnings.description: People who are switching to inhaled Pulmicort from oral corticosteroids should slowly decrease their medication slowly. Quitting oral corticosteroids too quickly can cause an adrenal suppression and adrenal crisis. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy, low blood pressure, fever, confusion, and depression. Switching from oral corticosteroids can also lead to a condition called Churg-Strauss syndrome which can have symptoms of rash, heart pain, and breathing difficulty.

basics.benefits_moa: Qvar is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Qvar is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Qvar every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.

userStories.tip: I was using many years. In 2005 I had a bleeding episode that could have been a side effect. in 2012 I had my first seizure and decided to read all my med labels. I quit Singular that day.

My daughter was prescribed Singulair when she was six. Horrible side effects to mental and cognitive functioning. Learned after the fact some singular has similar effects on other kids. Parents beware.
I can't take inhaled corticosteroids to control my asthma. This has worked quite well meanwhile..

I wish I hadn't let the fear of the depression side effect prevent me from taking singular for so long,  it works where inhalers do not work for me, and it controls my asthma well in generic montelukast form or Singulair form.
Don't skip a day because it isn't fast acting.  My cat allergies act up for days after being near a cat.

My insurance refuses to cover Singulair, but the generic form doesn't seem to control my asthma as well. One of my pharmacists told me this was the case for himself as well, and that generic was better just for allergies. Singulair is $$$
Caused major depression and angry outbursts which is very unusual for me. I ended up taking half dosage along with St Johns Wort to balance.

For the first several months I did not follow the instructions and took it in the morning (alongside Allegra, Zyrtec, whatever I was using at the time). Now I take it at night and it's far more effective for managing asthma symptoms.
Works perfectly without any side effect, just one pill before going to bed.
I take it at night, along with 2 puffs of Symbicort 80/4.5mcg

risks_warnings.title: Sudden onset of asthma
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Aggression and agitation
risks_warnings.description: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. Symptoms range from irritability and memory problems to hallucinations and suicidal thinking. It is not clear if this is linked to history of these conditions. Get medical help immediately if you notice symptoms of agitation, aggression, sleep disturbance, or suicidal thoughts while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. risks_warnings.title: Blood disorder (eosinophilia)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of a blood disorder in people taking Montelukast. It's not clear what the link is between this blood vessel condition and Montelukast. Talk to your doctor if you notice red patches/rash or skin color changes on lower legs, numbness/tingling, or worsening of your asthma symptoms. You may need to stop taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

carousel_items: Lowers inflammation and opens airways to improve breathing.
Prevents breathing problems, but doesn't stop sudden cough or wheezing once they start.
Starts working in about 30 minutes, but can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel full effects.
Use inhaler in a level position, and don't breathe out into the device.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Shake inhaler for 5 seconds before you use it.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than a month since your last dose.
Call 911 or your doctor if it's hard to breathe, or if you have an asthma attack while taking this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Symbicort is a combination medicine. Budesonide (a corticosteroid) lowers lung inflammation to control asthma and COPD. Formoterol (a bronchodilator) relaxes muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Symbicort is good for people who need two medicines to control their asthma or COPD, but it might be expensive since there's no generic available.
downsides: You have to use Symbicort twice a day, every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Lower doses are not as effective for COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma-related death
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Symbicort. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Symbicort should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Symbicort, a combination drug.

risks_warnings.title: Pneumonia
risks_warnings.description: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Symbicort. It is important that your doctor monitor you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
COPD includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema

description_processed.orig: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Symbicort. It is important that your doctor monitor you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Symbicort too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Symbicort.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Symbicort may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.
risk_factors: Higher dose of the corticosteroid medication contained in Symbicort

description_processed.orig: One of the medications in Symbicort may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Symbicort. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Symbicort, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs) found in Symbicort, a combination medication.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Symbicort. risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: Symbicort may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Symbicort, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: History of arrhythmia, hypertension or heart failure

basics.benefits_moa: Terbutaline is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Terbutaline is effective at preventing asthma attacks, but isn’t the first choice. It’s generally well-tolerated, but let your doctor know if you feel more lightheaded or have a rapid heartbeat while taking this medicine.
downsides: Only lasts about six hours.
Can raise your blood sugars. If you have diabetes, check your sugars regularly and let your doctor know if they’re higher than usual.
Takes about 30 to 45 minutes to start working, so it won’t help an asthma attack once it starts.

risks_warnings.title: Bronchospasm (difficulty breathing)
risks_warnings.description: Even though Terbutaline is used to treat asthma, sometimes it can actually make peoples’ airways more cramped, so it’s harder to breathe. If you're feeling short of breath and it's not going away, seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Some people who take Terbutaline have had allergic reactions to it. If you start getting hives, a rash, swelling of the face, and find it hard to breathe, seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: Some people who take Terbutaline have had allergic reactions to it. If you start getting hives, a rash, swelling of the face, and find it hard to breathe, seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Cardiovascular (heart) disease
risks_warnings.description: Terbutaline may raise your blood pressure, heart rate, and affect your heart rhythm. Let your doctor know if you start experiencing more rapid heartbeats.

description_processed.orig: Terbutaline may raise your blood pressure, heart rate, and affect your heart rhythm. Let your doctor know if you start experiencing more rapid heartbeats.

risks_warnings.title: Premature labor
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes people will use Terbutaline to prevent premature labor. This purpose has not been FDA-approved and should not be used beyond 48-72 hours. Serious reactions, including death, high blood sugars, low blood potassium, and abnormal heart rhythms have happened to pregnant women who were given Terbutaline for premature labor.

You need to show an ID to buy Claritin D in the drugstore because it contains Pseudoephedrine.
Don't cut, crush, or chew tablets; swallow them whole.
It's better to take Claritin D early in the morning or when you wake up, otherwise you can have trouble sleeping later.

basics.benefits_moa: Claritin D is a combination medicine for allergies. Loratadine (an antihistamine) prevents allergy symptoms like runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes or skin. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Claritin D relieves allergies and congestion without causing daytime sleepiness. It can keep you up at night if you take it too close to bedtime.
downsides: You can have more side effects when using combination pills than when using single-ingredient medications.
The decongestant (Pseudoephedrine) can make your heart race or give you anxious or restless feelings.
You might not sleep as well due to Pseudoephedrine's effects and you can also have strange dreams while taking it.
Pseudoephedrine can raise your blood pressure, so don't take it if you have high blood pressure or other heart conditions.
Although you don't need a prescription, you do need to show a photo ID to buy this from behind the pharmacy counter.

upsides: The antihistamine (Loratadine) in Claritin D works as well as other antihistamines, but causes less drowsiness. It's also less sedating than Allegra D and Zyrtec D.
The decongestant (Pseudoephedrine) in Claritin D is stronger than other decongestants. It can also help relieve congestion-related headaches and ear pressure.
The stimulant effects of Pseudoephedrine can give you some extra energy during the day.
Doesn't give you rebound congestion (worse congestion symptoms after you stop taking the medicine) like decongestant nose sprays can.
It's available without a prescription, unlike other strong allergy medicines.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Claritin D works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure.  Don't use Claritin D if you have high blood pressure.

description_processed.orig: Claritin D works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure.  Don't use Claritin D if you have high blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: The stimulant effect of Claritin D can make your heart work harder than it can handle. Avoid using Claritin D if you have any history of heart conditions. Talk to your doctor for a safer option that would be better for you.

description_processed.orig: The stimulant effect of Claritin D can make your heart work harder than it can handle. Avoid using Claritin D if you have any history of heart conditions. Talk to your doctor for a safer option that would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizure
risks_warnings.description: Claritin D can make it easier for your brain to have a seizure. For most people this won't be a problem. If you have a history of seizures or epilepsy you should avoid using Claritin D and talk to your doctor for a safer option that would be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Claritin D can make it easier for your brain to have a seizure. For most people this won't be a problem. If you have a history of seizures or epilepsy you should avoid using Claritin D and talk to your doctor for a safer option that would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Claritin D may cause birth defects or problems during pregnancy.  This can be worse when taken during the first trimester of pregnancy (weeks 1 - 13). Don't use Claritin D while pregnant. If you're pregnant talk to your doctor or pharmacist about other treatments for congestions.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin D.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin D.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin D.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin D and stop using it if you have side effects.

drugs.name: Claritin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it only once a day.
Starts working in a few hours.
Can make you feel sleepy, so take it at bedtime if needed.
Avoid possible side effects by drinking plenty of non-caffeinated liquids.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor about trying a nasal steroid instead, which might work better for you long-term.
Using an antihistamine eye drop might work better to help itchy or watery eyes.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Claritin.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Claritin can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Claritin contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

risks_warnings.title: Sudden onset difficulty breathing (paradoxical bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Combivent. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms worsen while taking Combivent, you may need to discuss other medication options that will treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Combivent may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. Tell your doctor if you notice a tremor, rapid heartbeat, get dizzy or have difficulty sleeping while taking Combivent, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: history of heart failure or chest pain.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening glaucoma
risks_warnings.description: If you have a certain kind of glaucoma and develop new eye pain, blurry vision, or your vision changes (see halos or different colors), tell you doctor right away. These symptoms may be caused by Combivent. Your doctor may have other treatment options for your condition.

description_processed.orig: If you have a certain kind of glaucoma and develop new eye pain, blurry vision, or your vision changes (see halos or different colors), tell you doctor right away. risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Combivent should not be sprayed toward the face or in the eyes. It can cause new eye pain, blurry vision, vision changes or worsen already existing eye problems. Tell your doctor if you notice new symptoms or worsening eye problems from accidentally spraying Combivent into your eye or during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty urinating
risks_warnings.description: People with an enlarged prostate or urinary obstruction have reported worsening of symptoms.  Tell your doctor right away if it is difficult or painful to urinate while taking Combivent.  Your doctor may discuss other medications to treat your COPD.
risk_factors: History of urinary bladder blockage (urinary obstruction)

description_processed.orig: People with an enlarged prostate or urinary obstruction have reported worsening of symptoms.  Tell your doctor right away if it is difficult or painful to urinate while taking Combivent.  Your doctor may discuss other medications to treat your COPD.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of severe allergic reactions in people taking Combivent with a history of atropine allergy. Combivent has a chemical structure similar to atropine so if you've had an allergic reaction to atropine, there is a possibility you will be allergic to Combivent. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Combivent. Talk to your doctor about other medication choices to treat your COPD if you know you have an allergy to the drug atropine.

risks_warnings.title: Low potassium
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Combivent causes potassium levels in the body to decrease, sometimes significantly. Low potassium levels can worsen existing heart problems or cause new symptoms. Let your doctor know about other medications you are taking and if needed, get your potassium checked periodically.

Talk to your doctor about other medication choices to treat your COPD if you know you have food allergies to soybean and/or peanuts.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Zyrtec.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Zyrtec.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Zyrtec and stop using it if you have side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Zyrtec can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Overdosage
risks_warnings.description: People with kidney or liver disease may need to take a lower dose of Zyrtec to prevent overdose. Talk with your doctor to be sure you are using the correct dose.

basics.benefits_moa: Albuterol is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the muscles that tighten your lungs during an asthma attack. This opens airways and makes breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Albuterol is good at stopping asthma attacks and helping you breathe.
downsides: Can make your heart race temporarily.

downsides_processed.orig: Can make your heart race temporarily.

upsides: Stops asthma attacks.
Can also help prevent asthma attacks caused by exercise.
While there are technically no generic versions of Albuterol, there are many competing brands, which keeps prices pretty low.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: When you get a cold/flu/bronchitis/allergies, talk to your doctor to find out if temporary changes to your medications should be made.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: More apples, tea, plain yogurt; less flavorings, especially in sticky things like sugary drinks, mouthwash, and candy.  Fresh air (away from triggers) when you're having symptoms is crucial, but fresh air when you're healthy is also very important.

surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Make and keep your home and car trigger-free zones; hey your family and visitors on board.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Find a doctor who listens.  Track your asthma (time, place, symptom, severity, trigger, treatment, effect) in an app or small note book.  Take your Rx as prescribed, but if you're concerned or confused talk to your doctor until you get answers.  Don't delay treatments, and get fresh air away from triggers.  Steam shower immediately after nebulizer treatments may make them more effective.  Eat clean, avoid artificial flavors, sweeteners, and preservatives.  Hot tea, lemon (juice or zest), ginger, yogurt, apples, and olive oil are all foods that may help immediately (tea, lemon, ginger) or long term.
